org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.format

Interface DOMMessage


  • public interface DOMMessage
    A Message where the payload is held as a DOM Document

      • getSimpleSOAPHeader

        java.lang.String getSimpleSOAPHeader(java.lang.String uri,
                                   java.lang.String name)
        Return a simple SOAP (1.2 or 1.2) header - which has only one String value as its text content. Caches the simple headers on first invocation
        Parameters:
        uri - the namespace URI
        name - the element local name
        Returns:
        the simple SOAP header - if any exists by the name

        Extract the result of the given XPath expression as a String
        Parameters:
        exprn - the XPath expression to evaluate
        ns - optional array of namespace prefixes and uris
        Returns:
        the textual result of the XPath expression evaluation, or null

      • writeTo

        void writeTo(java.io.OutputStream os)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Write the contents of this message into the provided OutputStream
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failure

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Return an InputStream to read the DOM message payload. Creates a temporary file, and serializes the DOM Document into it, and returns an InputStream over it - thus this is an expensive operation
        Returns:
        an InputStream to the payload
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failure

      • addAttributeToElements

        void addAttributeToElements(java.lang.String exprn,
                          java.lang.String qName,
                          java.lang.String nsUri,
                          java.lang.String value,
                          java.lang.String[][] ns)
        Add an attribute to each instance of the specified elements
        Parameters:
        exprn - the xpath expression to the elements where the attribute should be added
        qName - the qualified name for the new attribute
        nsUri - the namespace URI for the new attribute, or null
        value - the new value of the attribute
        ns - an optional array of namespace prefixes and namespaces used within the XPath expression

      • getAttribute

        java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String exprn,
                            java.lang.String[][] ns)
        Get attribute value
        Parameters:
        exprn - the xpath expression to the element where the attribute should be added
        ns - an optional array of namespace prefixes and namespaces used within the XPath expression
        Returns:
        attribute value

      • replaceAttribute

        void replaceAttribute(java.lang.String expression,
                    java.lang.String value,
                    java.lang.String[][] ns)
        Replaces the value of the specified attribute/s e.g replaceXMLAttributeValues(msg, "//order[1]/@id", "8");
        Parameters:
        expression - the xpath expression to the attribute/s, which should be replaced
        value - the new value of the attribute
        ns - an optional array of namespace prefixes and namespaces used within the XPath expression

      • addTextElementsAsChild

        void addTextElementsAsChild(java.lang.String expression,
                          java.lang.String qualifiedTagName,
                          java.lang.String namespace,
                          java.lang.String elementContent,
                          java.lang.String[][] ns)
        Inserts Text Element as a child to the specified elements pointed by an xpath expression
        Parameters:
        expression - the xpath expression to the node/s, which will be the parent for the new node/s
        qualifiedTagName - the qualified name of the new element to be added
        namespace - an optional String specifying the namespace url of the new element
        elementContent - the text content of the new element
        ns - an optional array of namespace prefixes and namespaces used within the XPath expression

        void removeSoapHeader(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String uri)
        Removes the specified SOAP header and its descendants if any from the payload
        Parameters:
        name - the local name of the header to be removed
        uri - the name space uri of the soap header to be removed

                         java.lang.String uri,
                         java.lang.String content)

        Parameters:
        name - local name of the new header to be added
        uri - the namespace uri of the soap header to be added

                             java.lang.String uri,
                             java.lang.String content)
        Replace String based SOAP header
        Parameters:
        name - local name of the header to be replaced
        uri - the namespace uri of the soap header to be replaced
        content - updated content for the SOAP header

                    java.lang.String uri)
        Delete a SOAP header and its descendants
        Parameters:
